RegionLength.name: Descriptor region length
RegionLength.help_text: If non-zero, specifies the length of the Descriptor region.

NumComponents.name: Number of Flash Components
NumComponents.help_text: Specifies the number of Flash components that will be installed on the target machine. Valid values are 0,1,2 - 0 causes only ME region to be built.

ComponentBaseAddr.name: Component Base Address
ComponentBaseAddr.help_text: Identifies address bits [11:4] for the Component portion of the Flash Descriptor.

RegionBaseAddr.name: Region base address
RegionBaseAddr.help_text: Flash Region Base Address (FRBA). This identifies address bits [11:4] for the Region portion of the Flash Descriptor. Bits [24:12] and bits [3:0] are 0.

NumMasters.name: Number of Masters
NumMasters.help_text: Number Of Masters (NM). This field identifies the total number of Flash Regions. This number is 0's based.

MasterBaseAddr.name: Master base address
MasterBaseAddr.help_text: Identifies address bits [11:4] for the Master portion of the Flash Descriptor.

SocStrapLength.name: Number of SOC straps
SocStrapLength.help_text: SOC Strap Length (PSL). Identifies the 1s based number of Dwords of SOC Straps to be read, up to 255 DWs (1KB) max. A setting of all 0's indicates there are no SOC DW straps.

SocBaseAddr.name: SOC straps base address
SocBaseAddr.help_text: Flash SOC Strap Base Address (FPSBA). This identifies address bits [11:4] for the SOC Strap portion of the Flash Descriptor. Bits [24:12] and bits [3:0] are 0. For validation purposes, the recommended FISBA is 0x10.

ProcStrapLength.name: Number of CPU Strap Length
ProcStrapLength.help_text: The number of PROC straps to be read. Valid values are 0 to 1.

ProcBaseAddr.name: PROC straps base address
ProcBaseAddr.help_text: Flash Master Base Address (FMBA). This identifies address bits [11:4] for the Master portion of the Flash Descriptor. Bits [24:12] and bits [3:0] are 0. A recommended FMBA is 20h.

ReadStatusFreq.name: Read ID and Read Status clock frequency
ReadStatusFreq.help_text: If more that one Flash component exists, this field must be the lowest common frequency of the different components.

WriteEraseFreq.name: Write and erase clock frequency
WriteEraseFreq.help_text: If more that one Flash component exists, this field must be the lowest common frequency of the different components.

FastReadFreq.name: Fast read clock frequency
FastReadFreq.help_text: This field is undefined if the Fast Read Support is set to false.

DensityComp1.name: Flash component 1 density
DensityComp1.help_text: This field identifies the size of the 1st Flash component.

DensityComp2.name: Flash component 2 density
DensityComp2.help_text: This field identifies the size of the 2nd Flash component.

DualOutputFastReadSupport.name: Dual Output Fast Read Support
DualOutputFastReadSupport.help_text: false: Not Supported. true: Dual Output Fast Read instruction is issued in all cases where the the Fast Read would have been issued.

InvalidInst0.name: Invalid Instruction 0
InvalidInst0.help_text: Op-code for an invalid instruction that the Flash Controller should protect against chip erase. This byte should be set to 0 if there is no instruction to protect against.

InvalidInst1.name: Invalid Instruction 1
InvalidInst1.help_text: Op-code for an invalid instruction that the Flash Controller should protect against chip erase. This byte should be set to 0 if there is no instruction to protect against.

InvalidInst2.name: Invalid Instruction 2
InvalidInst2.help_text: Op-code for an invalid instruction that the Flash Controller should protect against chip erase. This byte should be set to 0 if there is no instruction to protect against.

InvalidInst3.name: Invalid Instruction 3
InvalidInst3.help_text: Op-code for an invalid instruction that the Flash Controller should protect against chip erase. This byte should be set to 0 if there is no instruction to protect against.

FlashPartitionBndry.name: Flash Partition Boundary
FlashPartitionBndry.help_text: The FPBA build settings are configurable in Build -> Build Settings.

LowerFlashEraseSize.name: Lower Flash Erase Size
LowerFlashEraseSize.help_text: For Asymmetric flash parts, this is the lower of the two erase sizes.

UpperFlashEraseSize.name: Upper Flash Erase Size
UpperFlashEraseSize.help_text: For Asymmetric flash parts, this is the upper of the two erase sizes.

ReadAccess.name: Read Access
ReadAccess.help_text: 0xFF = Debug/Manufacturing, 0x0B = Production, 0x1B = Production w/ access to PDR (should ONLY be used if PDR region is implemented). Each bit corresponds to Regions [7:0]. If the bit is set, read access is granted. Flmstr1[23:16]

WriteAccess.name: Write Access
WriteAccess.help_text: 0xFF = Debug/Manufacturing, 0x0A = Production, 0x1A = Production w/ access to PDR (should ONLY be used if PDR region is implemented). Each bit corresponds to Regions [7:0]. If the bit is set, write access is granted. Flmstr1[31:24]

ReadAccess.name: Read Access
ReadAccess.help_text: 0xFF = Debug/Manufacturing, 0x0D = Production. Each bit corresponds to Regions [7:0]. If the bit is set, read access is granted. Flmstr2[23:16]

WriteAccess.name: Write Access
WriteAccess.help_text: 0xFF = Debug/Manufacturing, 0x0C = Production. Each bit corresponds to Regions [7:0]. If the bit is set, write access is granted. Flmstr2[31:24]

BiosPr4Base.name: BIOS Protected Range 4 Base
BiosPr4Base.help_text: Specifies the lower base of the BIOS protected range number 4. Address bits [11:0] are assumed to be 12'h000 for the base comparison. (goes to bits [12:0] at register: [Protected_Range_4] PR4 (@0x84)).

BiosPr4Limit.name: BIOS Protected Range 4 Limit
BiosPr4Limit.help_text: Specifies the upper limit of the BIOS protected range number 4. Address bits [11:0] are assumed to be 12'hFFF for the limit comparison. (goes to bits [28:16] at register: [Protected_Range_4] PR4 (@0x84)).

BiosPr4WriteProtEn.name: BIOS Protected Range 4 Write Protection Enable
BiosPr4WriteProtEn.help_text: When set, this bit indicates that the Base and Limit fields are valid and that writes directed to addresses between them (inclusive) must be blocked by hardware. The base and limit fields are ignored when this bit is cleared. Disabling this protected range could be done also by the security override pin strap. (this soft strap and the security override pin strap are reflected into bit 31 at register: [Protected_Range_4] PR4 (@0x84)).

SpiBootBlockSize.value: 00: 64KB (Default): Invert A16 if Top Swap is enabled.
SpiBootBlockSize.value_list: 00: 64KB (Default): Invert A16 if Top Swap is enabled.,,01: 128KB: Invert A17 if Top Swap is enabled.,,10: 256KB: Invert A18 if Top Swap is enabled.
SpiBootBlockSize.name: SPI Boot Block Size

LPSS1_F0_Disable.name: SIO1 F0 Disable
LPSS1_F0_Disable.help_text: Disable LPSS1 function 0 (DMA). false = enable. true = disable.

LPSS1_F1_Disable.name: SIO1 F1 Disable
LPSS1_F1_Disable.help_text: Disable LPSS1 function 1 (PWM#1). false = enable. true = disable.

LPSS1_F2_Disable.name: SIO1 F2 Disable
LPSS1_F2_Disable.help_text: Disable LPSS1 function 2 (PWM#2). false = enable. true = disable.

LPSS1_F3_Disable.name: SIO1 F3 Disable
LPSS1_F3_Disable.help_text: Disable LPSS1 function 3 (HSUART#1). false = enable. true = disable.

LPSS1_F4_Disable.name: SIO1 F4 Disable
LPSS1_F4_Disable.help_text: Disable LPSS1 function 4 (HSUART#2). false = enable. true = disable.

LPSS1_F5_Disable.name: SIO1 F5 Disable
LPSS1_F5_Disable.help_text: Disable LPSS1 function 5 (SPI). false = enable. true = disable.

SccEmmcDisable.name: SCC eMMC 4.41 Disable
SccEmmcDisable.help_text: Disable legacy eMMC 4.41. false = enable. true = disable.

SccEmmcPlusDisable.name: SCC eMMC 4.5 Disable
SccEmmcPlusDisable.help_text: Disable eMMC 4.5. false = enable. true = disable.

SccSdioDisable.name: SCC SDIO Disable
SccSdioDisable.help_text: Disable SDIO. false = enable. true = disable.

SccSdcardDisable.name: SCC SDCARD Disable
SccSdcardDisable.help_text: Disable SDCARD. false = enable. true = disable.

HDA_Disable.name: HDA Disable
HDA_Disable.help_text: Disable HD Audio: false = enable, true = disable.

LpeDisable.name: LPE Disable
LpeDisable.help_text: Disable LPE. false = enable. true = disable.

UshDisable.name: XHCI Disable
UshDisable.help_text: Disable USH. false = enable. true = disable.

LAN_Disable.name: LAN Disable
LAN_Disable.help_text: Disable GbE: false = enable, true = disable.

SATA_Disable.name: SATA Disable
SATA_Disable.help_text: Disable SATA: false = enable, true = disable.

USB_Disable.name: EHCI Disable
USB_Disable.help_text: Disable USB: false = enable, true = disable.

PCIe0_Disable.name: PCIe 0 Disable
PCIe0_Disable.help_text: Disable PCIe port 0: false = enable, true = disable.

PCIe1_Disable.name: PCIe 1 Disable
PCIe1_Disable.help_text: Disable PCIe port 1: false = enable, true = disable.

PCIe2_Disable.name: PCIe 2 Disable
PCIe2_Disable.help_text: Disable PCIe port 2: false = enable, true = disable.

PCIe3_Disable.name: PCIe 3 Disable
PCIe3_Disable.help_text: Disable PCIe port 3: false = enable, true = disable.

LPSS2_F0_Disable.name: SIO2 F0 Disable
LPSS2_F0_Disable.help_text: Disable LPSS2 function 0 (I2C#0). false = enable. true = disable.

LPSS2_F1_Disable.name: SIO2 F1 Disable
LPSS2_F1_Disable.help_text: Disable LPSS2 function 1 (I2C#1). false = enable. true = disable.

LPSS2_F2_Disable.name: SIO2 F2 Disable
LPSS2_F2_Disable.help_text: Disable LPSS2 function 2 (I2C#2). false = enable. true = disable.

LPSS2_F3_Disable.name: SIO2 F3 Disable
LPSS2_F3_Disable.help_text: Disable LPSS2 function 3 (I2C#3). false = enable. true = disable.

LPSS2_F4_Disable.name: SIO2 F4 Disable
LPSS2_F4_Disable.help_text: Disable LPSS2 function 4 (I2C#4). false = enable. true = disable.

LPSS2_F5_Disable.name: SIO2 F5 Disable
LPSS2_F5_Disable.help_text: Disable LPSS2 function 5 (I2C#5). false = enable. true = disable.

LPSS2_F6_Disable.name: SIO2 F6 Disable
LPSS2_F6_Disable.help_text: Disable LPSS2 function 6 (I2C#6). false = enable. true = disable.

LPSS2_F7_Disable.name: SIO2 F7 Disable
LPSS2_F7_Disable.help_text: Disable LPSS2 function 7 (I2C#7). false = enable. true = disable.

DisBendClk_Ssen.name: DISBENDCLK_SSEN
DisBendClk_Ssen.help_text: Enable spread spectrum to DISPLAY BEND: false = disable, true = enable.

DispSsClk_Ssen.name: DISPSSCLK_SSEN
DispSsClk_Ssen.help_text: Enable spread spectrum to DISPLAY SS: false = disable, true = enable.

PciClk_Ssen.name: PCIECLK_SSEN
PciClk_Ssen.help_text: Enable spread spectrum to PCIe: false = disable, true = enable.

SataClk_Ssen.name: SATACLK_SSEN
SataClk_Ssen.help_text: Enable spread spectrum to SATA: false = disable, true = enable.

SmbusDisable.name: SMBUS Disable
SmbusDisable.help_text: Disable SMBus. false = enable. true = disable.

OtgSsDisable.name: OTG Super Speed PHY Disable
OtgSsDisable.help_text: Disable OTG Super Speed PHY. false = enable. true = disable.

UshSsDisable.name: XHCI Super Speed PHY Disable
UshSsDisable.help_text: Disable USH Super Speed PHY. false = enable. true = disable.

SscTable.name: Spread Percentage
SscTable.help_text: Select Spread Percentage (%). 0.456 is Intel recommended value. Other values are for testing purposes only.

LpcclkSlc.name: LPCCLK_SLC
LpcclkSlc.help_text: Select LPC return clock source. This soft-strap is reflected to LPCC.LPCCLK_SLC register.

LpcGpio.name: LPC GPIO Select
LpcGpio.help_text: Select the usage of LPC pins.

StgRen.value_list: 0 - PCIe PHY PS Configuration disabled (debug mode).,,1 - PCIe PHY PS Configuration enabled (default).
StgRen.name: PCIe PHY PS Configuration
StgRen.help_text: Sets the default PCIe PHY Configuration. 1 - PCIe PHY PS Configuration enabled (default). 0 - PCIe PHY PS Configuration disabled (debug mode).

LaneReversal.name: Lane Reversal
LaneReversal.help_text: Lane reversal: 0 = no lane reversal, 1 = lane reversal.

RootPortConfig.value_list: 00: 4x1s Port 1 (x1), Port 2 (x1), Port 3 (x1), Port 4 (x1).,,01: 1x2, 2 x1s Port 1 (x2), Port 3 (x1), Port 4 (x1).,,10: 2x2 Port 1 (x2), Port 3 (x2).,,11: 1x4 Port 1 (x4).
RootPortConfig.name: Root Port Configuration
RootPortConfig.help_text: Set the default value of Root Port Configuration.

PcieCmnlnPwrEn.name: PCIECMNLNPW Enable
PcieCmnlnPwrEn.help_text: false = disable, true = enable. Note: Integrated clock usage and specs must be signed off by SEG architects.

PcieLane0PwrEn.name: PCIELANE0PWREN
PcieLane0PwrEn.help_text: PCIE Enables power for digital (synthesized) logic for the Common Lane logic and PLL1Core uPAR: false = disable, true = enable.

PcieLane1PwrEn.name: PCIELANE1PWREN
PcieLane1PwrEn.help_text: PCIE Enables power for digital (synthesized) logic in the data lane to reduce leakage.

PcieLane2PwrEn.name: PCIELANE2PWREN
PcieLane2PwrEn.help_text: PCIE Enables power for digital (synthesized) logic in the data lane to reduce leakage.

PcieLane3PwrEn.name: PCIELANE3PWREN
PcieLane3PwrEn.help_text: PCIE Enables power for digital (synthesized) logic in the data lane to reduce leakage.

PcieLane4PwrEn.name: PCIELANE4PWREN
PcieLane4PwrEn.help_text: PCIE Enables power for digital (synthesized) logic in the data lane to reduce leakage.

SataCmnlnPwrEn.name: SATACMNLNPW Enable
SataCmnlnPwrEn.help_text: false = disable, true = enable. Note: Integrated clock usage and specs must be signed off by SEG architects.

SataLane0PwrEn.name: SATALANE0PWREN
SataLane0PwrEn.help_text: SATA Enables power for digital (synthesized) logic for the Common Lane logic and PLL1Core uPAR: false = disable, true = enable.

SataLane1PwrEn.name: SATALANE1PWREN
SataLane1PwrEn.help_text: SATA Enables power for digital (synthesized) logic in the data lane to reduce leakage.

SataStatus2Pmc.name: satastatus2PMC
SataStatus2Pmc.help_text: false: sata to indicate D3 status to PMC. true: sata to indicate DEVSLP status to PMC.

VendorId.name: Vendor ID
VendorId.help_text: The vendor specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId0.name: Device ID 0
DeviceId0.help_text: The first device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId1.name: Device ID 1
DeviceId1.help_text: The second device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

VendorId.name: Vendor ID
VendorId.help_text: The vendor specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId0.name: Device ID 0
DeviceId0.help_text: The first device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId1.name: Device ID 1
DeviceId1.help_text: The second device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

VendorId.name: Vendor ID
VendorId.help_text: The vendor specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId0.name: Device ID 0
DeviceId0.help_text: The first device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId1.name: Device ID 1
DeviceId1.help_text: The second device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

VendorId.name: Vendor ID
VendorId.help_text: The vendor specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId0.name: Device ID 0
DeviceId0.help_text: The first device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId1.name: Device ID 1
DeviceId1.help_text: The second device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

VendorId.name: Vendor ID
VendorId.help_text: The vendor specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId0.name: Device ID 0
DeviceId0.help_text: The first device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId1.name: Device ID 1
DeviceId1.help_text: The second device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

VendorId.name: Vendor ID
VendorId.help_text: The vendor specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId0.name: Device ID 0
DeviceId0.help_text: The first device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId1.name: Device ID 1
DeviceId1.help_text: The second device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

VendorId.name: Vendor ID
VendorId.help_text: The vendor specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId0.name: Device ID 0
DeviceId0.help_text: The first device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId1.name: Device ID 1
DeviceId1.help_text: The second device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

InputFile.name: OEM Section Binary input file
InputFile.help_text: The contents of this file (up to 256 bytes) are copied directly into the OEM section of the Flash Descriptor.

RegionLength.name: BIOS region length
RegionLength.help_text: This is the size of the BIOS region in bytes. Set this to 0 to make the region length equal to the binary file length (rounded up to 4k). Extra space will be filled with 0xFF.

InputFile.name: BIOS binary input file
InputFile.help_text: This is the BIOS image binary that will be copied into this region.

RegionLength.name: PDR region length
RegionLength.help_text: This is the size of the PDR region in bytes. Set this to zero and specify an input file if you want the tool to determine the appropriate size for the region.

InputFile.name: PDR binary input file
InputFile.help_text: This is the PDR image binary that will be copied into this region.

InputFile.name: TXE Binary Input File
InputFile.help_text: This is the path to a binary file that will be used for the TXE region.

RegionOffset.name: Region Offset
RegionOffset.help_text: The offset from the beginning of flash where the TXE region will start. If 0, then FITC will determine where to put it based on the region order.

RomBypassVector.name: Rom Bypass Vector Instruction
RomBypassVector.help_text: Up to 128 bits, this field represents the instruction that is placed at the beginning of the FPT used to jump to the Rom Bypass partition.

RegionLength.name: TXE region length
RegionLength.help_text: This is the size of the TXE region in bytes. Set this to 0 to make the region length equal to the binary file length (rounded up to 4k). Extra space will be filled with 0xFF.

FlashCycleLifetime.name: Flash Cycle Lifetime
FlashCycleLifetime.help_text: Time in years the flash should last.

FlashCycleLimit.name: Flash Cycle Limit
FlashCycleLimit.help_text: This number multiplied by 1000 equals the maximum number of erase cycles the flash can perform.

TicksToAdd.name: Ticks to add
TicksToAdd.help_text: This is used for access management.

TokensToAdd.name: Tokens to add
TokensToAdd.help_text: This is used for access management.

FptHeaderVer.name: FPT Header Version
FptHeaderVer.help_text: Defines the FPT header type set in the FPT header.

FptEntryType.name: FPT Entry Type
FptEntryType.help_text: Defines the FPT entry type set in the FPT header that defines the type of entries used in the FPT.

SecLayoutType.name: TXE Layout Type
SecLayoutType.help_text: This setting reflects the layout type used after modifying the build settings.

FwuOemId.name: FW Update OEM ID
FwuOemId.help_text: Enter UUID or file containing the UUID. This UUID will make sure that customers can only update a platform with an image coming from the OEM of the platform. If set to zero than any input is valid (including none) when doing a FW update.

HostSecRegUnlock.name: Host TXE Region Flash Protection Override
HostSecRegUnlock.help_text: Set this to TRUE if you want the ability to have BIOS write to the TXE Region. Set to FALSE to opt out.

OemTag.name: OEM Tag
OemTag.help_text: An OEM identification number to describe the flash image represented by the value.

HideFwUpdCtrl.name: Hide FW Update Control
HideFwUpdCtrl.help_text: Setting this parameter to 'true' will not allow end users to 'disable' or 'password protect' the TXE FW Update mechanism

FpfMirroringFile.name: FPF Mirroring File
FpfMirroringFile.help_text: Enter a path to the FPF mirroring file. Note: This option will create a FPF configuration for TXE Firmware to emulate fuse configuration for testing purpose. This option will not program real fuses. Fuse values programmed here will not be used once manufacturing is closed. Real fuses should be programmed using Flash Programming Tool before closing manufacturing.

CekConfiguration.name: CEK Configuration
CekConfiguration.help_text: Binary file to use for CEK Configuration. Must be exactly 256 bytes.

ATPerm.name: Intel (R) Anti-Theft Technology Permanently Disabled?
ATPerm.help_text: Select whether Intel (R) Anti-Theft Technology is permanently disabled.

NfcActive.name: Near Field Communication Enabled
NfcActive.help_text: This setting determines whether Near Field Communication is enabled.

NfcSlaveAddress.name: I2C Address
NfcSlaveAddress.help_text: This I2C address should match the I2C Address on the NFC hardware device.

UpgrdSrvcOdmId.name: ODM ID used by Intel (R) Services
UpgrdSrvcOdmId.help_text: ID generated by or registered with Intel (R) Services web servers in order to identify the ODM/Board builder. First of three IDs stored in flash and accessible through Intel (R) TXEI interface.

UpgrdSrvcSysIntId.name: System Integrator ID used by Intel (R) Services
UpgrdSrvcSysIntId.help_text: ID generated by or registered with Intel (R) Services web servers in order to identify the System Integrator. Second of three IDs stored in flash and accessible through Intel (R) TXEI interface.

UpgrdSrvcRsvdId.name: Reserved ID used by Intel (R) Services
UpgrdSrvcRsvdId.help_text: Reserved ID may be used for a Reseller ID or other Intel (R) Services IDs in the future.

PermitTimerResolution.name: Permit Period Timer Resolution
PermitTimerResolution.help_text: This setting determines what the permit period timer resolution will be.

AllowUnsignedAssertStolen.name: Allow Unsigned Assert Stolen
AllowUnsignedAssertStolen.help_text: true = Unsigned Assert Stolen is enabled. false = The Unsigned Assert Stolen is disabled.

ATBiosRcvryTimer.name: Intel (R) Anti-Theft BIOS Recovery Timer
ATBiosRcvryTimer.help_text: This timer will enable a stolen platform a 30 minute window to allow a FW/BIOS reflash before the system is powered down.

ATFpopHard.value_list: Always Allowed,,Allowed When AT Not Provisioned
ATFpopHard.name: Flash Protection Override Policy Hard
ATFpopHard.help_text: Indicates under which AT conditions it is allowed for TXE to enter disabled state to allow full SPI device re-flashing when the HMRFPO is set.

ATFpopSoft.value_list: Always Allowed,,Allowed When AT Not Provisioned
ATFpopSoft.name: Flash Protection Override Policy Soft
ATFpopSoft.help_text: Indicates under which AT conditions it is allowed for TXE to enter disabled state via BIOS based TXEI messages and allow TXE only region re-flash.
